website_summaries.verdict: Decent jumper cable set for emergency situations, but the gauge size may not be accurate. We like the addition of a carrying case, and the clamps do get a good "bite" on the battery posts.
pros: Remains flexible and tangle-free down to -40°F
Faster than average recharge time on dead batteries
Clamps designed to fit top or side post batteries at any angle
cons: 4 gauge wiring limits use to smaller vehicles, not commercial size
Exposed metal could present a shock or sparking hazard
Some user concerns about weak clamp strength

customer_reviews.title: Decent quality. Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: 20 foot 2 gauge cables I was surprised it came with a brush and pair of gloves. Nothing fancy but a bonus. The cables seem nice. The 2 gauge wire is stout. The clips and jaws have good resistance and firm feeling. These seem to be very nice right out of the box. I prefer a better bag but the one that comes with these is not bad and better than nothing. Time will tell how these hold up but for the price these seem pretty good. I use a $350 set of jumper cables at work and while these can't compare to them they seem every bit as good for day to day needs.
customer_reviews.author: PW Dahmer

customer_reviews.title: Great Cables, Nice Length, Carries the Needed High Amperage
customer_reviews.text: I have had a pair of similar jumper cables for some 40 years when they were still had all copper wire. I put them in my new truck and bought this pair for my 1989 Silverado daily driver. With the winter storms, I have since had 2 occasions to use the Cartman cables and they worked great both times. The second time I jumped a friend's garden tractor which was located in a garage and it was great to have the 20' cables which just reached. Great clamps and the #4 gauge carries the needed amps to start bigger engines.
customer_reviews.author: Willy J

customer_reviews.title: Nice package comes with jumpers
customer_reviews.text: Impressive weight. Needed the extra length to assist others. Came with a bag, gloves, and a metal brush to clean the terminals. Wasn't expecting all that. Everything fits nicely into the bag, and is stored in my Jeep. Just in case.
customer_reviews.author: Lj K

customer_reviews.title: Top Line
customer_reviews.text: These are the nicest cables I have ever had and would expect I would never need another pair unless of course these disappear somehow. The cheaper ones always break, most always the plier coming loose from the wire. Not these. I did opt for the UL label. It's quite possible the ones $3 cheaper without the label are the same? I don't know. I certainly am very satisfied with this buy.
customer_reviews.author: petsrus

customer_reviews.title: While I'm not looking forward to using these again, I kind of am.
customer_reviews.text: High build quality, excellent grip force. I've used it twice so far, and the 16' really made a difference over my old 12' set. The grips held well and bit through the paint on the battery terminals to make a solid connection. While I'm not looking forward to using these again, I kind of am.
customer_reviews.author: Xomby

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: These cables latch on great and are heavy duty. The clamps have strong jagged teeth for extra grip. I bought these because I find myself needing them really often. I bought the 25ft cables, they are great especially if you’re in a packed parking lot. You don’t have to wait on someone immediately next to you to come back to their car to jump you. With these I was able to get someone to help that was a few cars down from me. Also comes with gloves, carry bag drawstring, and rust brush. 10/10
customer_reviews.author: Adriana

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Length
customer_reviews.text: While I haven't had many dead batteries over the years, I swear each time I have, the car has been parked in the worst position possible to get a jump start. After the last headache, I was done and went looking for extra long jumper cables. These are perfect as they are long enough to go the length of my car to get a jump from a car that pulls up behind me and they are stored in a nice bag to keep them neat in the trunk until I need them.
customer_reviews.author: 2 Dogs R Us

customer_reviews.title: Rugged
customer_reviews.text: So far, the insulation on the 2 AWG copper is good--that's mostly what you want in this thing, as well as the alligator clips and how well they are insulated. I have these in my trunk--unfortunately they're in the heat most of the time, so it's probably not fair to judge these in 5 yrs compared to if I lived in a cold climate. In the mean time, these are good enough for commercial vehicles.
customer_reviews.author: Robert W

customer_reviews.title: wire insulation split after just 2 uses
customer_reviews.text: I was initially please with these jumper cables. they are heavy duty and long. I kept them in my garage. I had only used twice. I took them off the shelf to jump start someone's car and notice the insulation was split wide open exposing bare wire. I'm very disappointed in this. I might have expected that from a cheap set of cables but not these. I cannot recommend buying these jumper cables unless you want a disposable set.
customer_reviews.author: Wes Moyer

customer_reviews.title: Thought I had a set of cables
customer_reviews.text: After reading some of the reviews I figured it was worth a try. Glad I did they are better than I expected. They are very flexible, great length, The clamps are heavy duty with a very strong grip.This is the first set of cables I have seen with the cables attached to the clamp with a nut and bolt not crimped together. Hard to believe what you get for the price. Till now i use to think I had a set of jumper cables no now I do I don't know how you can go wrong buying this set. Thank you guys for this great deal.
customer_reviews.author: cal 1964

customer_reviews.title: Comes With Everything!
customer_reviews.text: I did not expect to come with a pair of gloves and a brush to jump start your car! The overall, the cables are strong and durable and long enough to reach uncomfortable reaches
customer_reviews.author: Jesse Torres

customer_reviews.title: sturdy lifetime jumper cables
customer_reviews.text: These are solid, sturdy lifetime jumper cables. The 2 gauge wires are thick , heavy, and seem as though they will be nearly impossible to kink. The included storage bag is roomy, with a large drawstring opening for easy in/out. My order also happened to include a surprise brass wire brush to remove potential corrosion from the battery connection prior to using...These are vastly superior the el cheapo gas station cables that I am replacing, whose clamp connections twisted off mere months after purchase simply because of repeated stuffing/removal from cramped storage bag...Really pleased with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: SweetFika

customer_reviews.title: Not just great value, excellent product.
customer_reviews.text: After ordering the jumper cables I wondered if they would be constructed of coarse multistrand copper wire because the price was less than the competitors. I was pleased to see fine strand copper wire like that associated with welding equipment. Haven't given it a full test yet but the 25' length is also a great feature allowing the cable to reach from front to rear of a vehicle.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny

customer_reviews.title: A must for heavy duty vehicles
customer_reviews.text: Made the difference in jumping a diesel pick-up that could not be jumped with a standard set of cables. They are substantial (heavy) and take up some room but they work well. I was able to jump a completely dead (one dead battery and the secondary battery was also failing) GMC 2500 Diesel with a Honda CRV with no trouble on the first try. The length makes nose to tail jumping possible when on the side of the road.
customer_reviews.author: KGS

customer_reviews.title: Good solid cables!
customer_reviews.text: As you can see in my pictures... these are good solidly made jumper cables... not too thick, not too thin. Comes with a basic black bag that has a barrel style cord lock stopper so you can cinch the bag up to securely keep the cables inside. Also, has a nice instructional sheet attached to the cables to give you a friendly reminder on how to attach the cables properly to the batteries.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Buy these you won't regret it!
customer_reviews.text: I originally bought some dinky cables and returned them because the cables were short and didn't jump cars when I tried them. I'm so content with these cables because they are super long and they actually work. I had to jump a truck that was not facing in a direction that was easily accesible, and these cables were long enough to reach and successfully jump the truck. They also came with a bag, a brush to clean off corrosion on the battery terminals, and clear instructions on how to use the cables.
customer_reviews.author: Ceeh

customer_reviews.title: What a great START!
customer_reviews.text: I used the CARTMAN Heavy Duty cables today for the first time. My wife's car would not start, and it was in the garage. With these cables, which are 20 feet long, I simply drove my GMC Acadia up behind her car and the cables were long enough to reach from my battery connections to her car. Since the cables are 2 gauge, there was plenty of power to crank her 5-year-old battery for a great start!
customer_reviews.author: Terry L. Mendenall

customer_reviews.title: I AM impressed!!!
customer_reviews.text: Just to say that I AM IMPRESSED with the purchase. Received it and am IMPRESSED!! I'm a mechanic, by history, and when I opened the box, I WAS impressed. I bought it for the wife's car, for her security in times of need, even though she calls me for car issues.. ANYWAYS, I opened the box, nice cables, came with a pull string bag and GLOVES, which is a SURPRISE to me. It'll make the wife feel safer,,,, THANK YOU!!!! HAPPY WIFE,,, HAPPY LIFE!! Going to purchase more from them!!!
customer_reviews.author: Army gal

customer_reviews.title: Very impressed!
customer_reviews.text: I was expecting just whatever jumper cables, you get a little bag to stow them, and they also send you a small wire brush as well as a pair of cotton gloves. I'm impressed with what they give you. It may not be the fanciest stuff but for the simple fact that they added gloves and a wire brush, unimpressed. I've worked for an Auto Parts Warehouse, ( I won't say the name because I have nothing good to say about that O place). Just to see the little extras with what I got from Cartman; I'm impressed and they will be helpful.
customer_reviews.author: Willie

customer_reviews.title: Remember, the smaller the wire gauge number, the larger the wire!
customer_reviews.text: Keep in mind that the smaller the wire gauge number, the larger the wire! Use that number to compare cables. Larger wires conduct electricity more easily, but they are of course bulkier. I think this kit is just about perfect for most uses. The case has a drawstring with lock, and is more than large enough for the cables -- sometimes manufacturers cheap out on cases, and you can barely fit the item in the case!
customer_reviews.author: craigery

customer_reviews.title: Great Heavy Duty Cables
customer_reviews.text: These are very nice cables. I just recently sat for about 30 minutes, helping someone jump their car with their cables. Their cables looked fine, but it just wasn’t happening. I finally said “I have cables in my truck if you want to try them”. Hooked up these cables and his diesel F350 fired right up. I would buy these again in a minute. They are heavy and take up some space, but the bag is nice and they work great.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Clina

customer_reviews.title: The negative clamps fell off of the cables
customer_reviews.text: I used these cables twice, and the second time both of the negative clamps fell off of the cable. Other than this one issue, they seem to by of fairly decent quality. I will solder all of the connections and call it a day. No more problems. It is impossible to buy good equipment anymore. I recommend purchasing #2 welding cable and some clamps, and building your own cables. It has always worked for me.
customer_reviews.author: groundhog

customer_reviews.title: Quality and Value in 6 gauge/16 feet length
customer_reviews.text: Weighty (I bought 6 gauge/16 feet - the smaller the gauge number, the thicker the wire). Comes with a storage bag, which keeps them neat and clean. Do yourself a favor and get at least 16 feet so if you need a jump and the car can't get close to the front of your car, you don't need to link two together (which is tricky and potentially dangerous). Excellent value and seem sturdy/long lasting
customer_reviews.author: Jet Jona

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for starting my GM vehicles
customer_reviews.text: Great booster cables: extremely well made with heavy duty low gauge wire, and extended contact clamps. The last part about the booster cables having extended clamps is extremely important to me, as we have three GM vehicles that have batteries with side posts. Regular booster cables won't stay at ya he'd to side post batteries very well, or for very long. These Cartman cables are designed with extended tips that make solid, reliable between the side post battery and the booster source. contact.
customer_reviews.author: mbut47

customer_reviews.title: Product is as described
customer_reviews.text: Luckily, I've not had to use the booster cables yet. It's as if the car knew it couldn't strand me with a dead (brand new) battery because I have the cables in the trunk now. lol In case anyone is wondering, I have a bad alternator and that's why I'm having problems with a new battery. I'm saving up money to get it repaired or replaced. But they look just like the pictures and descriptions, so I'm sure they will work just fine if or when I have to use them. They were a great price and the seller shipped super FAST!
customer_reviews.author: Vhester

customer_reviews.title: Okay for copper-clad aluminum
customer_reviews.text: Seems okay for the price, we will see when it actually comes time to use them. For now just in my trunk in case. They were nice enough to include bag and gloves. I would prefer solid copper strand as opposed to copper clad, but few sell solid anymore. If you need severe duty cables, build your own with solid copper strand welding cable; far cheaper than ready made.
customer_reviews.author: Frederico

customer_reviews.title: Get it going!
customer_reviews.text: The craftsmanship of these cables are the finest I have ever used in my 56 years. The length is 25 feet allowing for a safe space between vehicles. The clamps hold tight and the gauge size allows for high amperage usage when dealing with batteries that have over 600 cold cranking amps! I can not say enough good things about these Cartman booster cables!
customer_reviews.author: Joseph J

customer_reviews.title: Good sturdy cables.
customer_reviews.text: Bought my son a car for his 20th birthday. This cable is standard equipment in all our cars. Nice heavy cables. Well insulated with strong clamps. The storage bag is nice addition. Most folks call AAA for a jump and don't carry their own cables. Even if you have an AAA membership, you may want to help someone who does not. Emergency products like these are as much for others as for yourself.
customer_reviews.author: Boi Named Sous

customer_reviews.title: Long and flexible jumper cables
customer_reviews.text: I had a pair of 4 gauge jumper cables stolen and needed to replace them. After a lot of research the Cartman cables kept coming up in reviews as the best or one of the top 5. I ordered them and am not disappointed. They are long enough to reach even when vehicles are in awkward positions, they are very flexible even when cold, at 4-gauge they should carry substantial power even under the worst circumstances, and the carry bag was just an added bonus.
customer_reviews.author: D. Fertenbaugh

customer_reviews.title: Great cables!
customer_reviews.text: I'm so glad I purchased these cables! They are literally twice as thick as my previous, really cheap ones. When you grab these, you can feel the quality right away. These cables have weight, and it comes from the metal inside the rubber housing/hose. The clamps have a great bite and feel great and sturdy, like they'll last the lifetime of these cables! If you need cables, don't hesitate to get these! Priced great and work tremendously!
customer_reviews.author: heng vang

customer_reviews.title: WORTH EVERY PENNY
customer_reviews.text: I bought these as a “just in case” and the day after they arrived we had to use them on our sons car. They are great! They are heavy and the cables are “thick” ... definitely not flimsy or “cheap” at all ... hooked them up and we were good to go! They also come in a black bag and they actually do fit back into the bag after use .. just a way to keep the jumper cables tidy and out of the way. We are very pleased with our purchase and we even ordered another pair for our daughters car.
customer_reviews.author: dzbarley

customer_reviews.title: Bought for emergencies, helped others out!
customer_reviews.text: We are new to off-roading, but bought a nice little kit of products we might need for the unexpected emergency; from tools, to med-kits, we bought all sorts of things. We bought these jumper cables and put them in our tool bag for that worst case time... low and behold, 2 weeks after buying, we were out on a trip... came across some folks who had stopped on the trail in their UTV... and their battery was dead. We jump-started the UTV, and they were on their way! They work as advertised. They come in a nice handy little bag. So happy we bought these!
customer_reviews.author: Curt

customer_reviews.title: OK, but not deluxe
customer_reviews.text: The wire does not seem to have conductors as heavy as 4 gauge. Could be including the insulation. They seem flexible when new and not so unmanageable as to be a problem with storage. I've had older cables with higher gauge numbers which seemed more substantial. If you want the really deluxe cables, pay for them. Still, these are better than the minimal ones available.
customer_reviews.author: Old Equipment user

customer_reviews.title: The cables I received do not work
customer_reviews.text: Have tried to use these cables twice. Had good contacts and left cables hooked up for 30+ minutes and truck would not start (battery is good - less than a year old). Then I used my wife's cables that came with her VW and it started after less than two minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Tony Fischer

customer_reviews.title: Great value for money
customer_reviews.text: Everything looks good. Exactly as expected. Included set of gloves and brass brush. Bag is some version of cloth / polyester and should be fine for keeping cables together for infrequent use. NOTE: Came with a set of instructions for both Negative and Positive grounded vehicles. If you have new drivers, as I do, suggest you consider taking a sharpie to block-out the version that does not apply to vehicle(s) your kid will be driving. AGAIN... great buy. /thanks
customer_reviews.author: Bryan W.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect The price was super for these Jumper cables
customer_reviews.text: Perfect The price was super for these Jumper cables. I always make sure that my family members have a good set of Jumper cables in their cars. Just the other day my moms car would not start and these cables saved the day. Its really nice to know that People I care for have jumper cables that are reliable in their vehicles. The Clamps look really good and the cable is fastened securely in the clamp. Thumbs up.
customer_reviews.author: #1 Buyer

customer_reviews.title: Do not guess.
customer_reviews.text: I've used these 50 times and, despite me using these 50 times, and OTHER models another 300 times, I still have to consult my manual every time I jump my car. Also, let's be clear that those 350 times of using jumper cables were not always on my car. Regardless, these get the job done and I actually like the weird cloth bag they come in. Usually I won't use those things but this one is pretty good. Now I don't even consult the manual, I just guess and hope for the best.
customer_reviews.author: whippetnipples

customer_reviews.title: NEED A JUMP ????
customer_reviews.text: These are without a doubt the best made most functional jumper cables are the best that I have ever had......and I have grey hair! The clamps are functional, no moving required to have good a solid connection. The cable are flexible making it easy to use and then store. The length allows you to safely jump or get jumped without being out in traffic. The other item I appreciated is that the gauge allows you to start another - battery to battery without the jumping car exposing their electronics to damage from another system.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty jumper cables
customer_reviews.text: These are very heavy duty cables and exactly what I was looking for. My wife had cheaper, light duty jumper cables in her car. These cheaper cables failed to start the car on 2 different occasions, so I had to bring out my cables. I finally had enough and bought these cables as a replacement. These cables also came with a nice storage bag, gloves and a brass brush to clean battery terminal. I am very impressed with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Frank from San Diego

customer_reviews.title: They make a very nice jumper cable 2 gauge 20 foot is what I
customer_reviews.text: If you're ever going to need jumper cables 20 feet is about the minimum you ever want to buy because 12ft and some of those shorter ones sometimes you can't get to the battery depending how the car is sitting in the car your jumping off of is maybe behind you. They make a very nice jumper cable 2 gauge 20 foot is what I bought
customer_reviews.author: tvsteve

customer_reviews.title: versatile and great for road recovery
customer_reviews.text: great for emergencies, 25 foot long and i gauge cable with heavy duty clamps makes it easy to jump start any vehicle in any location-very long cables make it easy to position the 2 vehicles so that you can even park behind the car needing a jump and still reach the battery. will carry 800 amps with 1 gauge wires over this distance, so it will start anything including my dual battery f350 diesel.
customer_reviews.author: Mike HughesTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Great cables
customer_reviews.text: There were no dislikes at all. These cables exceeded my expectations and more. They are well made and you don’t have to worry about the cable being the right size for your starting power it’s waiting on you. If you had any problems , it would probably be everyone wanted to borrow them. So keepem close at all times
customer_reviews.author: tony

customer_reviews.title: Don't get stuck!
customer_reviews.text: Got these for my son who is away at school. He came home for the pandemic and his car battery died to the point of needing to be replaced. I got these as a safety feature and while I haven't needed to use them they are impressive. They appear to be heavy duty and the clamps are strong. If they work as good as they look they'll be a great buy!
customer_reviews.author: JJ Goodtimes

customer_reviews.title: Recieved opened box and used cables
customer_reviews.text: I'm just venting but the jumper cables I received where opened and appeared used. It's not the end of the world but there's principles involved here. I'd send them back but there jumper cables and there going to get dirty and what not so it's not worth it. On the other hand they appear sturdy and well made and I'm glad I bought them. I had to give them four stars just for general principle but they are five star cables.
customer_reviews.author: Ermster

customer_reviews.title: Nicely kit, with gloves and a case
customer_reviews.text: I only gave 4 starts for durability because there is no way to know in the first month if a product is durability. That 5th start gets awarded two years from now. The set I am replacing cracked and left me with exposed copper wires (bad when dealing with electricity). I am hoping these will be better. Too early to tell. Have jumped my car once and everything worked. A good start.
customer_reviews.author: D. Fogel

customer_reviews.title: Fake UL booster cable
customer_reviews.text: This cable is rated with UL, but actually it's fake. The conductor inside is copper plated with little copper, not copper clad aluminum. So the conductors are really easy to be broken during usage. And I tested the conductors, the resistance is really high. So I don't recommend CARTMAN booster cable. They are not integrity.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not reliable. I got one use before they broke
customer_reviews.text: I was excited about the price so I order two of these. My car needed a jump. It worked once. My car needed a jump a few weeks later, due to a battery drainage issue. The jump did not work. I tried the second set of cables and it worked. One use is not great even for $20 cables.
customer_reviews.author: arsnictruffle

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely love these! Have jumped a bunch of people with ...
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love these! Have jumped a bunch of people with much bigger batteries and engines with no issues. They even have numbering on them for the ideal sequence to attach them to the vehicles if you don't know. I like knowing that's there for if my wife ever needs to use them. (Though she now has of those neat battery jumpers so I don't have to worry about her needing to find help.)
customer_reviews.author: C. Strawn

customer_reviews.title: One set of Jumper Cables for every car
customer_reviews.text: The price versus the size wire and the quality of the Jumper Cables, was looking for the best quality for the money. Also like the way that they were package in a nice compact bag. When I got them made sure that they were what I ordered and went through the process of using them. Then had to get them back into the bag that they came in, always a problem, but there fitted right in....and now every car has a set of Jumper Cables....
customer_reviews.author: B Lester

customer_reviews.title: Best jumper cables ive ever owned. Also...best price
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product. For the price you absolutely will not find a better set of jumper cables. Do not hesitate if you need this item. The 20 foot length allowed me to jump my car that otherwise would have been impossible with the two sets of 8 foot cables that i had from my VW's.
customer_reviews.author: noneyerbussiness

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive, great quality, and bonus supplies
customer_reviews.text: Comes with bag, instructions, wire brush (for cleaning terminals to allow for good contact), and gloves (to avoid getting dirty). All 4 jaws are numbered directly on the cable so you always know what sequence to apply them without paper instructions. Cable is smooth and flexible. Hard to beat for $21. The jaws are asymmetrical (see third picture) which is good and bad. It allows for better side clamping on different styles of terminals - but it makes it basically impossible to clip from directly above the terminal. If you don't have much room around your battery terminals, it can be a little tricky to get a good connection.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon P.

customer_reviews.title: Does what it's supposed to do well!
customer_reviews.text: I've had one of these for a while and a cheap set for a while. Then my oldest started driving and after his battery died and the cheap cables were too hard for him to use well, I bought another one of these. Unfortunately, with 3 vehicles and living in northern Iowa, we have had too use these a few times. Never had a problem. They attache easily. The bag they come in is big enough that I don't have to play some sort of tetris to get the cable back in the bag. Overall a great product. I'll be buying one more some day (hope they go on sale).
customer_reviews.author: TiMonte

customer_reviews.title: THEY WERE SHORTED TOGETHER
customer_reviews.text: I bought these and stored them in my car for less than a year. After needing them for the first time, I found out the hard way, the cables were shorted together half way down and melted/welded together after connecting to a battery.
customer_reviews.author: Darek

customer_reviews.title: Also noted that everything looks fine and not "used"
customer_reviews.text: Heavy duty as advertised ... I and several others have noted that the box arrived with the "factory seal" broken on the box. Also noted that everything looks fine and not "used" ... they apparently add a battery terminal brush to the shipment (it's not listed in the contents in the product description) and that's the reason the seal is broken. I went through everything carefully and everything is there ... cables, storage bag and gloves (nice touch) as well as the terminal brush ... they all appear like factory fresh unopened products. Very pleased with it.
customer_reviews.author: Ron Fluegge

customer_reviews.title: Junk - Falling Apart After 6 Months
customer_reviews.text: After less than six months of very light use the neutral terminal (black) started to split exposing the copper wire inside that neutral cable. They have also never successfully jumped a vehicle for me. I have another by a different brand that have lasted 10+ years and still jumps cars just fine. I'm very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: M. Dougherty

customer_reviews.title: The BEST VALUE by Far!
customer_reviews.text: These CARTMAN jumper cables are the BEST I have ever seen! The gauge, sturdiness of construction, and long length of these cables were better than expected. The carrying case, wire brush, and protective gloves just put this product in a class by itself. The BEST value by far!
customer_reviews.author: Bradley from TN

customer_reviews.title: Longer than my old cables that I paid four times as much for
customer_reviews.text: Haven’t had a chance to actually need them yet but they look like good cables. I got these for my grandson’s truck and now I’ll be getting another set to keep in my 1970 elcamino even though I keep it on a battery maintainer you never know when a battery will konk out.... excellent value in my opinion and fast shipping
customer_reviews.author: dean hoskins

customer_reviews.title: These cables are worth more than you'll pay!!!
customer_reviews.text: The cables arrived on time and looked as expected. Like jumper cables. They are well made, and feel like they will last a lifetime. They were ordered because I need to jump a van and my cables were only 6 feet long. Now I've got a reach of 16 feet! Shouldn't be a problem.
customer_reviews.author: Tracy Arant

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Had to jump my car several times already. Just a quick unrelated tip, but please please please learn how to correctly hook up the cables if you haven't already. I posted the picture to this review. It will save you a whole lot of grief. I had to learn the hard way by almost blowing up my battery. Thank God that didn't happen, but I still managed to blow a fuse in my stereo (again thank God for fuses or I would've fried my stereo completely).
customer_reviews.author: Caleb Chiu

customer_reviews.title: Excellent cables - well built, and some added extras come with them!
customer_reviews.text: Fortunately I've not had to actually use these yet, but I am very impressed with the build quality, heavy duty clamps, and excellent 'extra' touches such as the carry bag with drawstring. Also an added bonus I wasn't aware of, but these come with a pair of light duty work gloves, and also a brass brush for cleaning the posts! Overall, these seem like very good cables, especially for the low price - bought a set for each of the family members to keep in their vehicles - better safe than sorry!
customer_reviews.author: RandomPhoto

customer_reviews.title: Seem to be good quality cables
customer_reviews.text: They seem to be good quality cables, come with a nice pouch for storage, a small wire brush, and even some utility gloves (thought that was a nice bonus). I can’t speak on the durability, but I see no issues. I got these for my wife’s car to replace older and thinner cables, happy I did.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Gibson

customer_reviews.title: These cables are Beast!
customer_reviews.text: My son used his jumper cables to try and jump my truck with his truck. After 20 mins. we gave up. I ordered these cables online with prime. The first try with these cables and my truck started right up. These cables are great! I have a Tundra and my son has a Tacoma. I also bought him a set of these cables and had him throw his other set away.
customer_reviews.author: RG

customer_reviews.title: Great value and high quality product
customer_reviews.text: This is a high quality item for a very reasonable price. I recommend it for each vehicle as it comes in a nice easily storable case that takes up very little space. Good value for the money and nicely packaged including a surprise pair of gloves to keep grease or dirt from your hands while working with it.
customer_reviews.author: Doug Brown

customer_reviews.title: Item did NOT have bag included
customer_reviews.text: This item arrived in a box and no carry bag was included like stated in the description. I intentionally ordered this one because it had a bag for easy storage under my back seat. I can purchase a different bag for this but this was false advertisement they should include everything they say they will in the description.
customer_reviews.author: Cheyenne

customer_reviews.title: True 4awg fine-strand copper cables.
customer_reviews.text: Bought them with a specific modification in mind and was surprised to find them priced so low, copper prices being what they are. I'd been modifying my Suburban to power a winch at either end of the vehicle, and since I had these large Anderson Power Pole connectors at rear bumper and front grill I thought it would be useful to have some long jumper cables that could also plug into those power plugs, so I bought this set new and chopped them in half as soon as I got them. Glad to find real copper.
customer_reviews.author: Richard A. Ray

customer_reviews.title: Bonus items!!
customer_reviews.text: I have been wanting to replace the set of jumper cables that I most likely forgot when I traded in my last car. I searched on Amazon and found these which, at 4ga, was pretty good for a CCA cable and at a reasonable price. When I got the cables, they were well packed, contained the cables and storage bag as advertised, BUT also included a small brush for cleaning any corrosion from the terminals AND a nice pair of thick cotton gloves which will definitely come in handy whenever I have to use the cables. It's nice to see a company do a little extra for a customer.
customer_reviews.author: William Rosenberg

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Battery Cables!
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy well made, best value for battery cables if you are in the market for new cables. These cables exceeded my expectations. Beyond Satisfied! This item came with the cables, battery cable bag, brush to remove acid leaks, and gloves for your safety.
customer_reviews.author: Infinityg35JT

customer_reviews.title: Two Thumbs Up
customer_reviews.text: I've used these a few times and they work great! They come in an awesome carry bag that keeps these bad boys compact in your car so they don't take up much room. What they DON'T tell you is that it comes with a sweet wire brush and pair of wool gloves! I was so stoked! The wire brush is a little flimsy, my dog got to it and it is no more. But everything else about this purchase has been top notch. I was very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Bridger H

customer_reviews.title: Heavy Duty, Durable, Outstanding!
customer_reviews.text: You really don’t get excited over jumper cables, but this set is dynamite! These are heavy duty cables, well made, durable, and extra long length at 20ft. I would recommend these to anyone who is looking for a set of serious jumper cables. 5 stars
customer_reviews.author: The WHITE ALBUM

customer_reviews.title: Color me impressed!
customer_reviews.text: These cables are both long and sturdy, and I like the fact that they come with a nice satchel. Plus, an added bonus that I thought was a really nice touch was the wire brush that also came with them (to clean off the battery contacts, which may well be necessary if a car is being jumped). So all in all, I'm happy with the build quality and the extra thought that went into delivering something above and beyond expectations. Color me impressed!
customer_reviews.author: Tim G.

customer_reviews.title: Almost too heavy duty!
customer_reviews.text: I guess I shouldn't complain. At the price, these 2 gauge cables are as advertised, heavy duty! They were definitely a step-up from what I was using which were probably just fine for what I needed, a set of jumper cables for general use jumping equipment at a small driving range and 25 acre practice facility and to carry around in my pick-up truck if I was called on to help out a friend of neighbor. With these, I'll look like a pro!
customer_reviews.author: jajohn

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for the money
customer_reviews.text: The best ones i have found so far. I made an amazing pair myself but they certainly did not cost a mere $25. Excellent prongs, solid wire and excellent construction for the money. There are things id like to see but they are probably not possible at this price point. Overall excellent for casual use.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Kirkpatrick

customer_reviews.title: Needed them the day they arrived
customer_reviews.text: Ironically I needed to jump one of my cars the day these arrived. The cables are very sturdy and their length made it easy to connect both vehicles. One feature I liked is the instruction label, attached to the cable itself, which shows you the order of connection. When you are on edge from having a car problem, which always happens at the wrong time, the instructions are nice to have and prevent sparks. I get anxious about scratching car paint, so I put two microfiber towels in the drawstring bag in which the cables arrived. I ended up buying two sets of cables for two cars.
customer_reviews.author: Scott G.

customer_reviews.title: Jumper Cables are Adequate but not impressive
customer_reviews.text: Clamps are stout, but the cable are not as well insulated and built as I expected. Definitely not industrial or "farm grade" as I expected but will work nicely for less demanding applications.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmyv

customer_reviews.title: Seriously heavy duty!
customer_reviews.text: These are seriously heavy duty booster cables. My last set didn’t hold up so well in my truck bed toolbox...which I ordered at the same time and the subsequently left the review in the wrong place. My bad. I haven’t used them yet, but I really like how heavy duty they are. The storage case is okay, and I would use the sticky pad phone holder, but it might get crowded in the cup holder where I usually put my phone. Maybe I’ll find a good use for it at some point.
customer_reviews.author: James P.

customer_reviews.title: No more pushing dead cars out of parking spaces to give them a jump!
customer_reviews.text: I should have bought 20 foot jumper cables years ago! No more pushing dead cars out of parking spaces to give them a jump! It's not just the length that makes them awesome: The wires are nice and flexible even at -15! The jaws are durable and the springs are hefty to get much better contact than the average set of jumpers. Insulation on the wires feels like it's going to last a long time. The bag is a nice way to keep them stowed while not in use.
customer_reviews.author: Fisqual

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty!!!
customer_reviews.text: The cable has a very good quality, definitely worth the price. It is long enough and the tongs are strong and resistant. The cable also comes with a complementary bag, a pair of gloves, and a metallic brush to clean the sulfated battery all which are bad quality, but it is still a good deal just because of the quality of the cable.
customer_reviews.author: Yunio

customer_reviews.title: Good price and versatile length
customer_reviews.text: This is the second set of Cartman 4 ga. jumper cables I have purchased. I bought this set for my wife's car. Versatile length at 16 ft and the 4 gauge size will allow them to be used from full size truck to any type of car. Storage bag that comes with the jumper cables helps keep them more compact for stowing them away :)
customer_reviews.author: Jr72

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Jumper Cables
customer_reviews.text: These jumper cables are great. 2 awg wire makes a reliable and hearty connection. And they are also 20ft long , which means in most cases I can jump the stranded vehicle without going head to head which can be dangerous !! And the price was just another bonus , very reasonable !!
customer_reviews.author: Brian B.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome cables, everyone should have this in their car.
customer_reviews.text: This is the second one I ordered. The first one was for my wife last year and my current cables needed to be replaced so I ordered these again. They're great! Nice thick gauge and I used them to jump start a car that was sitting there for about a month without being started and it started up in under 5 mins. They come with a case and gloves too so your hands don't get dirty. I recommend these for anyone looking for reliable cables.
customer_reviews.author: Tony Serrano

customer_reviews.title: These saved my bacon compared to getting stuck when using cheap thin cables
customer_reviews.text: I had two sets of cheap cables that people had left in cars I've purchased, and when I really needed them they failed me. I bought these after getting stuck with wimpy cables, and they've saved my bacon twice already. I love them. I went for the thickest gauge wire I could find and these can jump start a totally dead battery unlike the cheaper ones that with much thinner wire. More wire is more amperage and that's what you need for jump starting. Plus it came with a nice bag that they fit into for storing them.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. D

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy - faulty product
customer_reviews.text: The jumper cables I received were faulty. The cables overheated, melted and caused fire under my hood. Please think again before purchasing this product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great jumper cables!
customer_reviews.text: I reviewed several positive comments by others. The quality looks good and matches with the product description. I would not hesitate to recommend others ti buy this cables.I chose 6ga and believe it will be more than adequate for infrequent users like me and felt more comfortable by the UL rating.
customer_reviews.author: Ami Sidpara

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't quite feel like the other 4 gauge cables
customer_reviews.text: I am a little concerned about the quality of the cables. I was jumping a car and the cables appeared to get warm. Never experienced this with my other 4 gauge cables (Same car...same battery). Time will tell.
customer_reviews.author: James Fortune

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty
customer_reviews.text: Bought thesis for my sons truck. Extremely rugged a little heavy but that is because of length. While I really don't need 20' it is great to have when needed. You just need to make sure you have room to store in your vehicle. Comes with cleaning brush and gloves along with storage bag. Well worth the price do not hesitate to buy these especially for a truck or bigger vehicle.
customer_reviews.author: kate

customer_reviews.title: Good cables
customer_reviews.text: Replaced a set of cables that the insulation had started to crack and peel. Haven’t use the new ones yet so can’t rate durability but they met my expectations and came with gloves, which I wasn’t expecting.
customer_reviews.author: David T.

customer_reviews.title: Good quality - with instructions
customer_reviews.text: Very reliable cables so far. They are extra long which helps for when your car gets stuck in a tight space, It comes with a brush too and gloves. The handy bag keeps everything tight and easy to store in my trunk. The instructions are attached to the cables which is helpful.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Necessary for every car
customer_reviews.text: we were looking for a booster cable for our car and I found this on on Amazon. It has been very useful for some of the situations that someone car's battery did not work. I am going to buy it as a gift for some of my friends too.
customer_reviews.author: Merry

customer_reviews.title: Great jumper cables...
customer_reviews.text: Great jumper cables. What else do you need to know. I got the 4 gauge since they can carry more current. The little bag that comes with the cables is good enough to keep the cables coiled and tucked away. These are well built. I expect these cables to last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Bill W.

customer_reviews.title: Heavy Duty
customer_reviews.text: Jumper Cables are heavy duty. I was quite impressed with them once they arrived. Long enough to reach from the front of my car to the back, if pulled in to a space. No reason to be stranded with a dead battery again. They have been very good, and I expect them to last for years. Definitely worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: S.H.

customer_reviews.title: Grate set of jumber cables
customer_reviews.text: Grate value for your money i am very happy with my purchase the juper cables are very well made and was beyond what I was expecting with getting the brush in the gloves with just juber cables and caring bags as well. You could not go wrong with this purchase
customer_reviews.author: brandon mcmillen

customer_reviews.title: A good deal
customer_reviews.text: I needed a basic set of booster cables for emergency situations, and these seem like they will work just fine. I don't expect I'll need to use them too often so I wasn't looking for something specifically heavy duty. I appreciate that these came with a bag, and I was surprised by the gloves (not really necessary but nice) and the wire brush. Could come in handy!
customer_reviews.author: BrandyB

customer_reviews.title: Seems High Quality
customer_reviews.text: I had a pair like this before & they have always worked. Nice & thick but they still move in cold weather. Dont waste your money or smaller diameter jump cables as you want as much current to pass thru them as possible. These are also 20ft good for most situations. I like the case I put the jumper cables in them & leave them in my vehicle
customer_reviews.author: ken

customer_reviews.title: Excellent price for alot of cable
customer_reviews.text: I payed over double for a pair same guage same length at oreilly auto, granted they had nicer looking clamps not double price plus better. I bought these and cut the ends to power my 1500 watt inverter in my work truck worked excellent
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas R. Pierce

customer_reviews.title: Worked perfectly
customer_reviews.text: So glad I got these- they worked perfectly when I needed them too. I'd been saying to my husband that we needed to have some on hand, and not even a week after we got them my girlfriend's van wouldn't start and she was in a hurry to get to an appointment. We got my van out, followed the simple instructions and had her van jumped in less than five minutes. Worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: Lance V.

customer_reviews.title: Appear to be well built
customer_reviews.text: It's great to get 2 AWG cables for a wider set of vehicles the cables can be used on in the same price range as many 4 AWG cables. I was also very pleasantly surprised on opening the box to find a battery post brush for clearing corrosion and a set of gloves to use. Nice touch Cartman! I gave durability 5 stars based on initial build. Time will really tell.
customer_reviews.author: Ron

customer_reviews.title: Gets the Job Done
customer_reviews.text: Very heavy duty and durable jumper cables that are more than capable of getting the job done. The jumper cables also come with a carrying pouch and some shock resistant gloves for better and more professional use. No complaints and would highly recommend, it's always handy to have jumper cables on hand.
customer_reviews.author: Nato S.

customer_reviews.title: Good value, seemingly good quality
customer_reviews.text: I don't want cheap jumper cables that don't get the job done when my batter is dead. Would rather pay more for a good set. These seem to be okay, though they state the cable is not solid copper. However, I couldn't find any that are, so went with these. Did just fine the first time I used them.
customer_reviews.author: Dave Libertyville

customer_reviews.title: Good jumper cable set
customer_reviews.text: I've only used the cables once so far and they worked great. The length, wire gauge and clamps are of good quality from what i see. The storage bag, gloves and terminal brush are a nice touch.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Great quality.
customer_reviews.text: I bought two sets at the same time when the ones my girlfriend had fell apart when she tried to jump a friend. I ended up using them soon after they arrived. They seem to be very good quality and I love that they came with a carrying bag. The length is also awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

product_meta.title: CARTMAN Heavy Duty Booster Cables Jump Cable with Carry Bag, 2 AWG (2Gauge x 20Feet)
product_meta.description:
Size:2AWG/20'

When your car or truck needs a boost, the Cartman Extra Heavy-Duty Booster Cables are the safest way to transfer power from a 12/24-volt automobile battery. The easy-to-use, no-tangle cables have T-Prene coating for flexibility and easy storage. They feature special clamps with triple-polarity identification that is color-coded. The clamps also have an ergonomic design that is easy to use on top-post and side-terminal batteries.

Extra Heavy-Duty
Booster Cables
At a Glance:
T-Prene coating keeps cables flexible down to -25C/-13F
Cables work with top-post and side-terminal 12/24-volt batteries
2-gauge, heavy-duty, no-tangle cable construction
Ergonomically designed with shielded surfaces for safety
UL listed; RoHS compliant

The 2-gauge, heavy-duty cables are the strongest consumer grade available.


Heavy-Duty Cable Construction Resists the Elements
The booster cables are insulated with T-Prene coating, which is designed to remain flexible down to -25C/-13F. The 2-gauge, heavy-duty cables are the strongest consumer grade available, and they resist motor oil, rain, and chemicals for dependable use.

Available in 20 feet, will easily reach from one battery to another, whether you're working on a car, truck, or SUV.

What's in the Box
2-gauge booster cable
Woking gloves
Carry case

END
feature_bullets: Sufficient CCA (Copper coated Aluminium). For 600Amp use. Over 50% greater conductor than of a 4 Gauge.
Ideal for use with full size pickup trucks, large recreational vehicles and freight hauling vehicles.
Fits top and side post batteries; Luxurious carry bag for free. Patented design of inside tongue for double connection with battery terminal.
TPR material of cable, low temperature immunity (-25C/-13F)

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.8 out of 5 stars5,772 ratings4.8 out of 5 stars
